Name: Abu Dhabi
Description: The capital and largest emirate, located in the west of the UAE. It is known for its modern architecture, luxury shopping, and rich cultural heritage.

Name: Dubai
Description: The most populous emirate, known for its futuristic skyline, luxury hotels, shopping malls, and iconic landmarks such as the Burj Khalifa.

Name: Sharjah
Description: Located adjacent to Dubai, Sharjah is known for its arts, culture, and heritage, with a variety of museums, art galleries, and historic sites.

Name: Ajman
Description: A small emirate known for its beaches and developing tourism sector.

Name: Umm Al-Quwain
Description: The smallest emirate, known for its quiet and laid-back atmosphere, beaches, and historical attractions.

Name: Fujairah
Description: Located on the eastern coast along the Gulf of Oman, Fujairah is known for its mountainous terrain and beaches.

Name: Ras Al Khaimah
Description: Located in the northern part of the UAE, Ras Al Khaimah is known for its scenic mountains, deserts, and historical forts.
